intro: Talinum okanoganense, commonly known as Okanogan morning glory, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet trumpet-shaped flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant is a herbaceous annual that thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other morning glory species. Talinum okanoganense is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
